comments.body: The components are specified with a tag, so they are tagged with one or more of the tags that show up on the rhs when opening a new issure.

I tried opening an issuse as a non-developer and could add tags, but github might have seen through my disguise. Might be worth it if you open a ticket and see if you can tag it and set the milestone.
looks like github was indeed too clever and saw though your disguise, because I couldn't add tags when I opened a new issue

Good to know. I'd say the numpy version is important to know, the component not so much. If the function where the problem occurred is given, the component is discoverable and the developers probably have a better idea about what it is than the reporters.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +10,14 @@Please give as much information as you can in the ticket. It is extremely
useful if you can supply a small self-contained code snippet that reproduces
the problem. Also specify the component, the version you are referring to and
the milestone.
